member.name: MF_SOURCE_READER_FLAG
member.summary: Contains flags that indicate the status of the method.

member.name: MF_SOURCE_READER_FLAG.MF_SOURCE_READERF_ERROR
member.summary: An error occurred. If you receive this flag, do not make any further calls to methods.

member.name: MF_SOURCE_READER_FLAG.MF_SOURCE_READERF_ENDOFSTREAM
member.summary: The source reader reached the end of the stream.

summary.para: One or more new streams were created. Respond to this flag by doing at least one of the following:

item.description: Set the output types on the new streams.
Update the stream selection by selecting or deselecting streams.

member.name: MF_SOURCE_READER_FLAG.MF_SOURCE_READERF_NATIVEMEDIATYPECHANGED
member.summary: The native format has changed for one or more streams. The native format is the format delivered by the media source before any decoders are inserted.

member.name: MF_SOURCE_READER_FLAG.MF_SOURCE_READERF_CURRENTMEDIATYPECHANGED
member.summary: The current media has type changed for one or more streams. To get the current media type, call the method.

member.name: MF_SOURCE_READER_FLAG.MF_SOURCE_READERF_STREAMTICK
member.summary: There is a gap in the stream. This flag corresponds to an MEStreamTick event from the media source.

member.name: MF_SOURCE_READER_FLAG.MF_SOURCE_READERF_ALLEFFECTSREMOVED
member.summary: All transforms inserted by the application have been removed for a particular stream. This could be due to a dynamic format change from a source or decoder that prevents custom transforms from being used because they cannot handle the new media type.
